divs: Sighting DetailsWhile driving south on route 25 (from Trumbull to Bridgeport) at 5:25am I noticed a larger than normal star through the trees to the left of the highway. As I passed the trees, the light was very bright as when an airplane is approaching you in an angle where you can see its headlights. However, the light remained stationary and no sound came from it ( I lowered my car window to try to hear anything). To verify if the object was moving I decreased my car speed to about 25mph and it still appeared stationary. The object appeared too close and too big to be star. At least every other star I ever saw. When I reached my destination, I got out of the car and the object was still there, stationary. The light was solid and did not blink as stars do. After finishing the task at hand which lasted maybe 15 minutes I drove back home but was not able to locate the object in the sky any longer. All other stars that I recall where in the same reference position.
